INFOTRANSLATION: <p>Proposals will be considered eligible if they meet the following criteria:</p><ol><li><p>Consistent with <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="http://peoplepowered.org/about"><u>People Powered’s </u><strong><u>mission and values</u></strong></a></p></li><li><p>Contributes to the goals of People Powered <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ha6-zibY5SWfJybAKzxPszHJnxpiphbX/view?usp=drive_link"><strong><u>strategic plan</u></strong></a></p></li><li><p>Benefits the <strong>global </strong>People Powered community </p></li><li><p>Moves us toward <strong>future horizons</strong> of participatory democracy, by addressing long-term strategic challenges and opportunities</p></li><li><p>Can be implemented in 2026</p></li><li><p>Cost no more than $25,000 USD</p></li></ol><p></p>
PPDESCRIPTION: We will fund the most voted proposals within our budget constraints. If, after the top projects are funded, the remaining funds are not adequate to fund the next most voted for project, or if there's a tie, the Governance Committee will decide whether it is possible to partially implement the next project(s) with the available funds, or to choose one of the projects based on People Powered's values (inclusion, collaboration, problem-solving, equity and learning), or to choose to set aside the remaining money in a reserve fund, until adequate funds can be secured.
COWOPHEADER: Share your ideas for how to support MA worker owned cooperatives
COWOPSUBHEADER: Worker-owned cooperatives in MA, and partnerships led by worker owned cooperatives, are invited to share an idea between September 20 and October 1 2025, for how to use a portion of this money meaningfully. We encourage you to workshop your concepts with others, keeping in mind that your concept does not have to be long, or even fully developed. At this stage, we are looking for ideas that we can collectively develop into full proposals.
COWOPRESULTSABOUT: <p>After careful deliberation and interviews with all proposal teams, COWOP proudly announces the final projects to be funded through our bottom-up budgeting process!  An <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Vut_98L7WK2G9lJfF2fX2GG_gWQYpNpmnNRJLgAJUL4/edit?tab=t.jc1uksmlpuqv">expert team</a> reviewed 17 total proposals in line with our <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1REwc6lk0ZC6CWfUjEbNVkDWZIG9j0-gZbLls5XsGu4k/edit">funding rubric</a> and has decided to fund nine of them, mostly close to the full amount requested.  Congrats to all who participated, and set the stage for allocating our remaining $100,000 next year!</p>
COWOPRESULTSHEADER: COWOP's Funds Oversight Committee has made final decisions on allocating our first $100,000!
HORIZONRESULTSABOUT: <p>Learn more about the process and how decisions were made <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1umMJylcpBaMtT2OLnO4THaj2aPzJqyz_g73Wi2VCyLQ/edit?slide=id.g355b90e2c0a_0_0#slide=id.g355b90e2c0a_0_0">here </a> </p>

PPVOTINGDESCRIPTION1: Click on up to 5 proposals below to select them, then complete a short survey. This will take around 10 minutes.
PPVOTINGDESCRIPTION2: We have at least {budget} to allocate for budget proposals for 2026! Read through the proposals below and in the ballot and voter guide, and you can also take a look at the full texts and discussions by clicking on each proposal. Selected proposals will be implemented in 2026.

The Horizon Fund Committee is deliberati: The Horizon Fund Committee is deliberating based on their reviews and your votes. Results coming soon!

You can share feedback on different stag: You can share feedback on different stages of the process: idea collection, proposal development, ballot development, and vote. You can also share feedback on aspects such as the Zoom meetings, communications, timeline, inclusion, and technology.
